p: In the media, the destructive impact of tourism on the historic center of Venice usually tends to be the focus of attention. However, the fact that the city is also a production site of cruise ships is rarely discussed. In general, the industrial area of Marghera and the cruise ship industry located there remain largely invisible in the public eye.10 An equally blank space in the international perception of the lagoon city is its industrial past. Both of these factors are important for understanding current developments and debates.
